item.title: Unix Jobs Management
item.description: <img src="/media/300px-GNU_Screen.png" alt="GNU Screen" /> Every self respecting linux, mac os X or *nix user should have a solid handle on managing jobs in unix. The following will explain how to run tasks in the background, bring tasks to the foreground, background already running tasks and keeping a task running while logged out. Run a task in the background All you need to to is follow a command with the ‘&’ character.

item.title: Be more productive using GNU Screen
item.description: <img src="/media/300px-GNU_Screen.png" alt="Image via Wikipedia" /> <figcaption> <h4>GNU Screen</h4> <p> Image via Wikipedia </p> </figcaption> Despite living in the age of multicore processors, GUI everything and mountains of ram, I continually find myself more productive with a terminal open. Especially when that terminal is running GNU Screen. About GNU Screen GNU Screen is a free terminal multiplexer developed by the GNU Project. It allows a user to access multiple separate terminal sessions inside a single terminal window or remote terminal session.
